thread.title: Irish woman charged with murder over fiancé stabbed in neck and 'bleeding from the mouth'
thread.title_full: Irish woman charged with murder over fiancé stabbed in neck and 'bleeding from the mouth'

author: Stephen Jones
title: Irish woman charged with murder over fiancé stabbed in neck and 'bleeding from the mouth'
text:
News Irish woman charged with murder over fiancé stabbed in neck and 'bleeding from the mouth' Neighbours said they heard glass breaking and people screaming before Sydney police arrived to find Tina Cahill's partner David Walsh bleeding severely Share Tina Cahill, 25, is alleged to have used a knife to attack fiance David Walsh, 29 (Photo: Facebook) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
An Irish woman has been charged with murder after her fiancé was stabbed in the neck in Sydney, Australia. 
Tina Cahill, 25, is alleged to have used a knife to attack dad-of-three David Walsh, 29, outside his home shortly after midnight on Friday local time. 
She is expected to appear before a local Sydney court tomorrow morning. 
Police and ambulance services were called to the scene after ­reports of a fight between several people. 
The Irish Mirror reports that they arrived to find Mr Walsh bleeding severely from his neck and mouth. 
Neighbours today said they heard glass breaking and people screaming before emergency services arrived. 
New South Wales paramedics tried to revive David but he died at the scene. 
David, a father of three, grew up in Enniscorthy in Co Wexford, Ireland, before emigrating to Australia in recent years. 
A 36-year-old man was also arrested last night, but has since been released without charge. 
David's parents John and Ann received the devastating news of their son’s death on Friday afternoon. 
Family friend and county councillor Johnny Mythen told the Irish Daily Mirror that David’s death is a blow to the town. 
He was reared at the family home in Moran Park in Enniscorthy. News of David's death is described as a blow to the whole hometown back in Ireland 
“I would have known the chaps. They are a very big family. 
"Hard working people, Johnners is a self-employed builder, all of those chaps worked with their father from the ages of 12, 13, 14,” said Cllr Mythen. 
He added: “They would have been roofing, carrying slates up rooves… nothing came easy to that family they had to work very hard for everything. They could turn their hands to anything. They’d be gifted that way.” 
He described his death as “a parent’s worst nightmare”. 
“How they’re going to get there I don’t know. They’ll have so much to try and arrange to get the body home. It’s an awful situation,” he said. 
Junior minister Paul Kehoe, who lives just outside Enniscorthy, said: "I already spoke to Charlie Flanagan last night as I had heard it was somebody from Wexfod and I'll be speaking to him again." David Walsh was a father of three who emigrated to Australia (Photo: Facebook) 
He added: "This is very sad and tragic. For it to happen so far away makes it even more difficult for the family. I offer my sympathies and condolences." 
A friend posted on social media: "Absolutely heart broken an thats putting it mildly cant believe it cant get me head around it at all, just waiting wake up an it be all a bad dream so so many good memories." 
New South Wales Police said: "Police from Bankstown Local Area Command established a crime scene and arrested a 25-year-old woman, who is known to the dead man. 
"A 36-year-old Revesby man was also arrested and both were taken to Bankstown Police Station. 
"Bankstown detectives are being assisted by officers from the State Crime Command’s Homicide Squad. 
"Later this afternoon, the woman, who is an Irish National, was charged with murder. 
"She has been refused bail and will appear in Parramatta Local Court tomorrow (Sunday 19 February 2017). 
"The Revesby man continues to assist police with their inquiries. 
"NSWPF is working with the Irish Consulate in Sydney." 
A spokesperson for the Department of foreign affairs said they are providing consular assistance for the family. Like us on Facebook
